title: Egg Soup from Pavia
introduction: Egg Soup from Pavia, also known as Zuppa alla Pavese, is a delightful Italian dish featuring poached eggs in a savory broth. This quick and tasty soup is highlighted by perfectly set egg whites and indulgently soft yolks, making it an ideal meal for any time of the day.
ingredients: 2 quarts homemade Meat Broth or a mix of half store-bought broth and half water
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.description: Prepare the broth, if necessary. If not freshly made, heat the broth to a simmer. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Have ready 4 heated soup bowls. Place a slice of toast in each bowl, then crack an egg over each slice of toast.
Pour the hot broth over the eggs to cover by a few inches. Sprinkle with the cheese. Let stand until the egg white is cooked to taste. Serve hot.
